trial_identification.studytitle: HPV VLP as adjunct therapy for genital warts
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A phase 1b, multicentre study of CICRVax6 HPV6L1 VLPs as therapy for genital warts

conditions.healthcondition: Patients with persistent or recurrent genital warts

interventions.interventions: Vaccine will be given twice over one month to patients, concurrently with administration of conventional destructive therapy. Patients with genital warts will all undergo conventional destructive therapy and will additionally be randomized in block of 4 to receive either CICRVax6 (at one of three doses) or placebo twice at week 0 and week 4.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Percentage of patients disease free two and six months after vaccine administration/destructive therapy.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At 2 and 6 months after vaccine administration/destructive therapy

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients currently have clinically diagnosed genital warts, which were initially diagnosed at least three months ago, and have persisted or recurred after at least one course of conventional destructive treatment, willing to undergo further destructive therapy.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Patients have hypersensitivity to any component of the vaccine or patients currently taking systemic immunosuppressive or immunodulative medication, or topical imiquimod as wart therapy.

trial_design.concealment: Double blinded: patients allocated sequentially to patient numbers previously randomly allocated in block of 4 to: 3 vaccine, 1 placebo
trial_design.sequence: Blocks: One allocated to placebo by random number table generated electronically

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Centre for Immunology and Cancer Research, University of Queensland

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Anticipated trial start date: February 2006 (Brisbane), November 2005 (Wenzhou China) Target sample size: 240 (120 male, 120 female) at each site

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Brisbane Princess Alexandra Hospital Ethics Committee

contact.name: Professor Ian Frazer
contact.address: Centre for Immunology and Cancer Research 4th Floor Research Extension Princess Alexandra Hospital Building 1 Ipswich Road Woolloongabba QLD 4102

contact.name: Dr David Jardine
contact.address: Princess Alexandra Sexual Health Princess Alexandra Hospital Woolloongabba QLD 4102
